item.title: Sample Page
item.dc:creator: Glen_Dorner
item.content:encoded:
This is an example page. It's different from a blog post because it will stay in one place and will show up in your site navigation (in most themes). Most people start with an About page that introduces them to potential site visitors. It might say something like this:

Hi there! I'm a bike messenger by day, aspiring actor by night, and this is my website. I live in Los Angeles, have a great dog named Jack, and I like piña coladas. (And gettin' caught in the rain.)

...or something like this:

The XYZ Doohickey Company was founded in 1971, and has been providing quality doohickeys to the public ever since. Located in Gotham City, XYZ employs over 2,000 people and does all kinds of awesome things for the Gotham community.

As a new WordPress user, you should go to your dashboard to delete this page and create new pages for your content. Have fun!

item.title: Privacy Policy
item.dc:creator: Glen_Dorner
item.content:encoded:
Who we are

Suggested text: Our website address is: http://localhost/portfolio.

Comments

Suggested text: When visitors leave comments on the site we collect the data shown in the comments form, and also the visitor’s IP address and browser user agent string to help spam detection.

An anonymised string created from your email address (also called a hash) may be provided to the Gravatar service to see if you are using it. The Gravatar service privacy policy is available here: https://automattic.com/privacy/. After approval of your comment, your profile picture is visible to the public in the context of your comment.

Media

Suggested text: If you upload images to the website, you should avoid uploading images with embedded location data (EXIF GPS) included. Visitors to the website can download and extract any location data from images on the website.

Cookies

Suggested text: If you leave a comment on our site you may opt-in to saving your name, email address and website in cookies. These are for your convenience so that you do not have to fill in your details again when you leave another comment. These cookies will last for one year.

If you visit our login page, we will set a temporary cookie to determine if your browser accepts cookies. This cookie contains no personal data and is discarded when you close your browser.

When you log in, we will also set up several cookies to save your login information and your screen display choices. Login cookies last for two days, and screen options cookies last for a year. If you select "Remember Me", your login will persist for two weeks. If you log out of your account, the login cookies will be removed.

If you edit or publish an article, an additional cookie will be saved in your browser. This cookie includes no personal data and simply indicates the post ID of the article you just edited. It expires after 1 day.

Embedded content from other websites

Suggested text: Articles on this site may include embedded content (e.g. videos, images, articles, etc.). Embedded content from other websites behaves in the exact same way as if the visitor has visited the other website.

These websites may collect data about you, use cookies, embed additional third-party tracking, and monitor your interaction with that embedded content, including tracking your interaction with the embedded content if you have an account and are logged in to that website.

Who we share your data with

Suggested text: If you request a password reset, your IP address will be included in the reset email.

How long we retain your data

Suggested text: If you leave a comment, the comment and its metadata are retained indefinitely. This is so we can recognise and approve any follow-up comments automatically instead of holding them in a moderation queue.

For users that register on our website (if any), we also store the personal information they provide in their user profile. All users can see, edit, or delete their personal information at any time (except they cannot change their username). Website administrators can also see and edit that information.

What rights you have over your data

Suggested text: If you have an account on this site, or have left comments, you can request to receive an exported file of the personal data we hold about you, including any data you have provided to us. You can also request that we erase any personal data we hold about you. This does not include any data we are obliged to keep for administrative, legal, or security purposes.

Where your data is sent

Suggested text: Visitor comments may be checked through an automated spam detection service.

item.title: Blog
item.dc:creator: Glen_Dorner
item.content:encoded:
Project: Papanek theme

Papanek is a stunning WordPress theme featuring a clean and minimalist design, complemented by an extensive pattern library inspired by the design philosophy of Victor Papanek.

Services

Development, Design

Client

Roman Fink

Year

April, 2023

Challenge

Target

Develop a simple and user-friendly WordPress theme for freelancers and digital agencies to quickly launch their websites.

What did we do?

Developed the design concept. Created patterns for the most used information blocks. Created ready-made templates for pages.

2 color styles: light and dark

Use a suitable color scheme to create the perfect website for your business.

54 block patterns

With big library of ready patterns you can build landing pages fast and easily.

Have an idea? Contact us!

Office 3
Main Street 17
Belgrade, Serbia

hello@romanfink.com

Contact us and provide details about your inquiry. Our team will get back to you soon.

[contact-form-7]

item.content:encoded:
Glenweb1

This project was developed in about 10 mins for a hosting project in 2023 around February. Featuring sensual dancing aliens, and a gripping story that will leave tears in your eyes...

Glenweb1

GlenDex

A pokemon comparing website using React and the pokeAPI

GlenDex

For this project, we had to make a website to compare something using API's and react. I chose the pokeAPI because I like pokemon but good lord what a load of work this one was.

Flickmania.com

The major end of year 1 group development project. Featuring the most hard work out of anything in my portfolio and the most visual examples actually related to the topic at hand.

Flickmania

A web-based-movie-streaming-service.

item.content:encoded:
Navigation

Portfolio Contact Me Blog

About me

Thats me!

This is a picture of me on a beach, incase you don’t have eyes: … . .. . . … . . . . . …

My name is Glen Dorner. I am a 20 year old Creative Technologies student studying at Open Window. I am slowly but surely becoming a full stack developer and hope to get into the industry as soon as I graduate next year (2024). I am proficient with HTML, CSS, JS, Jquery, React, Python and I know how to do google indexing, hosting and a little bit of wordpress.

0 Websites developed from scratch 0 Percent average score 0 Years of experience

My Skills

I have experience in the below languages and stylings as well as React, Python, and wordpress. I am mainly an IT student, learned in coding, so hire me for anything coding related. None of that designing stuff, literally just the coding.
Years of experience 6,5 years "Glen's CSS is so good I wish I was him he is so handsome and cool and good at CSS" Mister CSS Website guy Skills  4.7/5

Check out my blog posts

Results may vary! Does this sound familiar? Your computer sputters smoke from the radiator grill as you boot up CS:GO for the 9th time today. You check your task manager in between the 20 minutes it takes for the game to open. CPU temp idling...

Curb that CS:GO unboxing addiction! Its time to CODE! Does this sound familiar? You’ve got a 12 page e-commerce website due in 10 minutes from now, that’s worth 30% of your grade BUT you just cant manage to get started AT ALL? Like you are...

AI makes my job so much easier…

4 Jun 2023

…And it could do the same for you! Over the last couple of years AI companies have been hard at work creating the ultimate thief, to steal everyones jobs and income. For us coders though, we don’t have to worry at all! AI is here,...

item.title: Glenweb1
item.dc:creator: Glen_Dorner
item.content:encoded:
What is glenweb1?

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=W5UkA2Gg-Cc Glenweb1 (Rest in peace) was the end of term project for SEO and general optimization, a subject that I took in term 1 of year 2. Essentially, when you typed "glenweb.co.za" into your URL bar on google, it would redirect you to an unsecure page where this video would autoplay. Above the video was the text "UNMUTE FOR PROOF" as the video could only autoplay if it was muted.

Some context

To give some background as to why this was allowed to happen: for the term we were supposed to host a website and track its traffic through google indexing. The lecturer for said subject however, told us that it did not really matter what we hosted, so I decided to have some fun.  After we had the briefing in week 1, I coded the entirety of glenweb1 in about 10 minutes. And just like that, everyone I knew was about to find out what I had made as well...

Technologies used

Because of it's beautiful simplicity, glenweb1 really only had 2 coding languages used in it's entire development cycle: HTML and CSS. The embedded video was inside of an i-frame provided by youtube, and the heading and background were styled using CSS

Where is glenweb1 now?

Sadly, glenweb1 had to be taken offline. Due to the requirements of the brief, it was succeeded by glenweb2.co.za, but things just weren't the same. Axxess was giving issues with the hosting, and wanted to charge me on top of sucking a lot of ass, so glenweb1 had to be removed. However, some circles in the know believe that I still have the files somewhere on my laptop, steeping and oozing in a dark corner of my hard drive... just waiting for the day that glenweb1 will come online again...

item.title: GlenDex
item.dc:creator: Glen_Dorner
item.content:encoded:
What is GlenDex?

GlenDex is a website where you can view the stats of a pokemon on a handy chart, compare two different pokemon against each other and even view the statistics of different things over the generations of pokemon games. This was the end of term final project for term 1 of year 2 of interactive development. I got 80% for it and im proud.

How did it look?

It looked beautiful

Technologies used

This one was very complex to make, requiring me to learn a host of new skills as well as gain total understanding of an API I have never used before. There was minimal HTML usage, but the CSS used would make Amazon blush. Of course this whole thing was done is react.js as well, which was a major source of frustration as react is a very unwieldy beast to work with. I will now attempt to list all of the technology I used: 1. React 2. Chart.js 3. PokeAPI 4. ChatGPT 5. CSS 6. HTML 7. Bootstrap 

Where can I find GlenDex?

The files for GlenDex can be found on github using this link and downloading the files off of github. There is a readme file that explains all of the tech and setup required to use the website properly. This website was never hosted online.

item.title: Flickmania.com
item.dc:creator: Glen_Dorner
item.content:encoded:
What is Flickmania?

Flickmania was the end of the year mega project for my first year of development at open window. We had to develop a streaming service website, using an API that has the data of basically every movie ever made. We then had to integrate this API with our website which was particularly hard because each of my group members had to do a different page.

Technologies used

Because this was the end year project of only the first year, we did not yet have to go crazy with the technologies we used, we just had to utilize what we did learn that year to its fullest extent. The CSS file was a mile long, the HTML file was incomprehensible, but luckily we had separate JS files so I could at least understand mine a bit. The API also gave some issues every now and then by not displaying what we wanted, but in the end everything worked out.

Where can I find Flickmania?

You can find the full directory on github using this link. There is no readme file, as this was before I had learned how to make a readme file. Have fun!

item.title: Refund and Returns Policy
item.dc:creator: Glen_Dorner
item.content:encoded:
This is a sample page.

Overview

Our refund and returns policy lasts 30 days. If 30 days have passed since your purchase, we cant offer you a full refund or exchange.

To be eligible for a return, your item must be unused and in the same condition that you received it. It must also be in the original packaging.

Several types of goods are exempt from being returned. Perishable goods such as food, flowers, newspapers or magazines cannot be returned. We also do not accept products that are intimate or sanitary goods, hazardous materials, or flammable liquids or gases.

Additional non-returnable items:

  • Gift cards
  • Downloadable software products
  • Some health and personal care items

To complete your return, we require a receipt or proof of purchase.

Please do not send your purchase back to the manufacturer.

There are certain situations where only partial refunds are granted:

  • Book with obvious signs of use
  • CD, DVD, VHS tape, software, video game, cassette tape, or vinyl record that has been opened.
  • Any item not in its original condition, is damaged or missing parts for reasons not due to our error.
  • Any item that is returned more than 30 days after delivery

Refunds

Once your return is received and inspected, we will send you an email to notify you that we have received your returned item. We will also notify you of the approval or rejection of your refund.

If you are approved, then your refund will be processed, and a credit will automatically be applied to your credit card or original method of payment, within a certain amount of days.

Late or missing refunds

If you havent received a refund yet, first check your bank account again.

Then contact your credit card company, it may take some time before your refund is officially posted.

Next contact your bank. There is often some processing time before a refund is posted.

If youve done all of this and you still have not received your refund yet, please contact us at {email address}.

Sale items

Only regular priced items may be refunded. Sale items cannot be refunded.

Exchanges

We only replace items if they are defective or damaged. If you need to exchange it for the same item, send us an email at {email address} and send your item to: {physical address}.

Gifts

If the item was marked as a gift when purchased and shipped directly to you, youll receive a gift credit for the value of your return. Once the returned item is received, a gift certificate will be mailed to you.

If the item wasnt marked as a gift when purchased, or the gift giver had the order shipped to themselves to give to you later, we will send a refund to the gift giver and they will find out about your return.

Shipping returns

To return your product, you should mail your product to: {physical address}.

You will be responsible for paying for your own shipping costs for returning your item. Shipping costs are non-refundable. If you receive a refund, the cost of return shipping will be deducted from your refund.

Depending on where you live, the time it may take for your exchanged product to reach you may vary.

If you are returning more expensive items, you may consider using a trackable shipping service or purchasing shipping insurance. We dont guarantee that we will receive your returned item.

Need help?

Contact us at {email} for questions related to refunds and returns.

item.title: AI makes my job so much easier...
item.dc:creator: Glen_Dorner
item.content:encoded:
...And it could do the same for you!

Over the last couple of years AI companies have been hard at work creating the ultimate thief, to steal everyones jobs and income. For us coders though, we don't have to worry at all! AI is here, and it knows how to code!

BUT

It can't create applications and webpages on its own yet! So for the time being we the humans are still on top! We can use the AI's thinking capabilities to our advantage and hit deadlines never thought possible. AI codes way faster than humans can ever dream of but, at such a big improvement comes a few detriments...

The restrictions of AI

AI (or at least the AI that the public has free access to) can only code up to about 500 lines before it breaks down. This means that if you require a program that is at all longer than 500 lines, or is a little bit complex, the AI cannot help you much. This is perfect for college applications though, as programs do not require that much complexity.

How AI has helped me

Personally, by having AI explain things to me and help me with some particularly troublesome code, I have saved countless hours of time! The AI just cuts out all of the excruciating pain of coding the boring business and the horrible pain of thinking! Personally, thinking is not my cup of tea. I have had countless experiences over my life where I have thought and lost, so I usually just go autopilot mode and everything seems to work out. This is where the AI can come in even more handy! By incorporating AI into my daily tasks, I go from 80% autopilot mode to 10%! Thats an increase of over...idk i'll ask the AI.

70%!!!!!!!!!!!!

Many people are worried about the "Advent of AI" and "The singularity" because AI has time and time again been cautioned to us. We have been warned over and over and over again about the dangers of letting AI run rampant and we have never needed to listen because AI tech seemed so far off.

AI kill drones

Just a couple of days ago an article leaked online about a company in America trying to create a, and I quote, "Kill drone" which uses AI tech to identify missiles and threats and kills them. The system works like this:


1. AI spots target, gets given a point
2. AI identifies target as threat, gets given another point.
3. AI waits for greenlight to kill from human operator.
4. AI kills target, gets given big point.


The issue however, arose when the AI identified a target as a threat and the human operator did not give the AI the go ahead on the kill order. The AI then proceeded to kill its human operator and then kill the threat. I have to clarify though, that this is a test being run INSIDE OF A SIMULATION and not a real happening.

Once this happened, the distressed scientists went into the AI's code and tweaked some things, basically telling the AI that it can't kill it's human operator. In the next test run, the AI identified a threat, and the operator again didn't give it the greenlight. The AI then targeted a communications tower nearby so that its operator could not tell the AI to not kill the threat.

The verdict

The future of AI is very bright, but its also so bright we need to carefully observe it with sunglasses so as to not make AI KILL DRONES.


Thank you

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Hi! I am a full-stack developer in training, here are some of the ways AI helps make my job way easier and quicker! Also kill drones!

item.title: How to concentrate (on coding)
item.dc:creator: Glen_Dorner
item.content:encoded:
Curb that CS:GO unboxing addiction! Its time to CODE!

Does this sound familiar?

You've got a 12 page e-commerce website due in 10 minutes from now, that's worth 30% of your grade BUT you just cant manage to get started AT ALL? Like you are just sitting with the code open in front of you but your brain is just flatlining the whole time. Well, that's happened to me so often that I have decided to make a guide about it.

Remove your desktop icons!

If you are a gamer (lets be honest, if you are coding you definitely play games), you probably have a million game icons on your desktop screen and spend hours staring at them like I do. I just can't decide what to play! And it takes so much time! To mitigate this, you can simply hide your game icons! to do this:

  1. Right click on your desktop.
  2. Click on view
  3. Click on "Hide desktop icons"

And boom! Gone! But if you don't like this you can always change it back, just follow the steps listed above again.

Just start! Its that easy!

If you are like me, starting is the hardest part, but actually working is easy. So to work effectively and efficiently, you need to build momentum! We're rolling stones baby! Often if you cant start with work, the easiest solution is to turn your brain off and get the work open in front of you. And then just start working. Start with the easy stuff to warm up and build momentum and then snowball like a league game from there! Lets get those minions gamers! Q!

Maybe take another break? Maybe?

Often while working it can be too hard to follow methods 1 and 2 above, so you could try just actually playing the game and letting the deadline roll over you! Research has shown the human brain can only concentrate for roughly up to 45 minutes before fatigue sets in, so why not take that break? Why not play that league match? Why not be lazy forever like the fat guys from WALL-E?

*(DISCLAIMER: THIS METHOD IS ONLY FOR MORONS WITH NO FUTURE)*

Seriously though, there's not much I can say in terms of coding. It comes naturally for me, I can just throw stuff up like I'm upchuck from ben10 and it always works out for me. My life is too easy (lying). But when I find myself in a situation where things have gotten too out of hand or too difficult there is one last method, one final solve all solution I can use. This method was passed down through generations of coders and I am about to pass it on to you... are you ready? Here it is...

Just give up

At the end of the day, you are not going to die if you don't fix that last stray pixel in the bottom right of your screen. If you literally cannot solve an issue, or you don't have time to solve it, or if its not a major issue, just quit. Its so easy. I do it all the time. Life is a game of survival and at the end of the day, if you are alive you are doing just as well as the greedy blackrock execs (scum of the earth).

The verdict?

Sometimes working can be hard, and I feel you brother. But we just need to power through it.

Thank you

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Sometimes we need that extra push to get started with our work. Well do I have the solution for you! Introducing... Click to read more

item.title: Where to find cheap pc components
item.dc:creator: Glen_Dorner

item.title: How to get good PC components
item.dc:creator: Glen_Dorner
item.content:encoded:
Results may vary!

Does this sound familiar?

Your computer sputters smoke from the radiator grill as you boot up CS:GO for the 9th time today. You check your task manager in between the 20 minutes it takes for the game to open. CPU temp idling at a cool 90C, usage at 110%. Your GPU has an exhaust mounted to it to help with ventilation, effectively giving your pc a horsepower measurement. Your 10x10p watch screen that you use to game on was recently cracked by a falling hair. Well, do I have the advice for you my man! Here are some of the best places to get free, top of the range components!

Just steal them!

Pictured above are some brave gamers (russian thieves) epically looting (stealing) a raid boss lair (Microcenter) some epic gamer loot! (several RTX graphics cards). They were obviously caught because of the cameras watching them, but you don't necessarily have to be! Target small chain shops like ***** or ******* ****** and you could be the proud owner of really any component of your dreams! All for free! Just be aware that this method really only works once, as any more attempts are very risky. Keep this in mind when going for that epic chicken dinner gamers!

Scrounge for tablescraps

If you would rather prefer to not have a criminal record (completely understandable) here's a little tip that those greedy BlackRock execs don't want you to know: when restaurants close at the end of they day, they have to throw out their left over food! If you are lucky, this could include stuff like a yummy nummy NVIDIA RTX 4090 Ti or maybe some hungry customer accidentally ordered too many Ryzen 5 7600x CPU's and had to send some back to the kitchen. Anything could be in one of these bad boys, so it's just up to you to find it.

Go buy some (with money)

If you are lucky enough to have a job and make a salary in money (mine is payed in megabytes) you could always exchange some money for the components you want. A secret tip that the greedy corporations want you to know is that you can exchange money for goods and services, but you need to be fortunate enough to have money in the first place. Most of us are wagepilled poor-cels who cannot even comprehend the thought of having more than 1 dollar in our accounts. How do you get a job in todays economy though? Here are some tips

Getting a job (cringe)

These days, the big money is all in investing, and the rest is in the IT industry. Those eggheads make millions every month, but how? They were born with it, or they cheated for it. Either way, here are some things that employers look for in coders these days:

  1. Several years experience in newly released coding languages and platforms.
  2. Full stack capabilities in newly graduated college students.
  3. The ability to work 48 hours every day.
  4. Team co-operation and coordination skills (doing entire projects by yourself).
  5. Endless patience.
  6. Endless obedience.
  7. Coding as fast as you can speak.
  8. Coding everything perfectly on the first try.

The verdict?

Steal, lie, scavenge and cheat your way to a better PC or you could always just, you know, pay for one.

Thank you

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Have you ever needed good components at a cheap price? Well sailer as luck be have it I have thar solutions for ye!

item.title: The best jobs for IT college graduates
item.dc:creator: Glen_Dorner
item.content:encoded:
Welcome to McDonalds, enjoy your stay!

Does this sound familiar?

You've just graduated from *INSERT TERTIARY SCHOOL HERE* with a shiny new *INSERT QUALIFICATION HERE* and you are looking to enter the job market and become a member of society at last. But alas, all of these big name tech companies wont stoop as low as to hire a no name, no experience computer baby like yourself.

Each place wants years and years of experience in newly released platforms, force work conditions akin to slavery and expect you to do this all in record breaking times. Its a dog eat dog world in the IT industry, but fret not! I am here with a comprehensive list of all the coolest spots looking for young talent like you! Let's dive in, shall we?

The N1 highway

Along the titular highway spanning across Southern Africa, you will find many bridges and intersections. Underneath these is where you are going to find some prime work opportunities. These employers are always friendly, offering snacks and even on site residences! How kind of them!

Although beware, some of these employers are not actively looking for new talent and may be hostile. It is rather easy to avoid these ones as they actively show signs of hostility, like growling and pointing their workstations at you. If the loud noises of passing cars are a bit too distracting for you, you might want to check out some of these other options.

Local in-and-out computerized establishments

Local spots like these are everywhere (unless you live in a rather poor country) so it should be rather close to your place of residence. These spots are always on the lookout for young blood and not just to put into their burgers! If you ask nicely, you just might find yourself slinging code (and patties) behind the counter. Places like these often require little to no experience and are open to all ages! Take note however, they do believe in an ergonomic, healthier way of coding and have thus implemented standing desks in all offices and removed the need for office chairs entirely! Well done!

But if the smell of cooking horse meat while you are working is a bit overpowering to your young nostrils, do not worry! There is one more spot that you can check out...

Go Freelance!

If you are a disciplined and focused coding machine, you could always opt to go freelance! If you can't find the jobs, have them come to you instead! Create a portfolio, and build an online CV to help people looking for freelancers find you more easily. Always remember to implement good SEO practices and be as detailed as possible about your previous works.

And remember, marketing is everything! Market, market, market. Get word of yourself out there in a way that the people enjoy and you will be drowning in the work in no time, although be sure you can still finish the comissions you get.

The verdict

Overall, finding any job in todays economy is hard. Connections mean everything, but if you are connectionless there is almost no hope for you.

Thank you

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Struggling to find a job in the coding area after graduating? Fear not! For I of infinite wisdom have come to guide you struggling lambs.
